attributes.action: Raise child refugee safeguarding needs with European partner states
attributes.background: Euro-pol believe that over 10,000 child refugees have gone missing since being registered on arrival in European Union countries. This suggests a complete absence of safeguarding of refugee children and therefore an unacceptable failure on the part of European states.
attributes.additional_details: Euro-pol news item on 31/1/2016. Over 10,000 registered refugee children missing.

attributes.action: Public Enquiry into the Google Tax Deal
attributes.background: Google has been allowed to pay just £130 million for over ten years worth of business. This is a tiny proportion of the company’s £3.93 billion annual UK revenues and amounts to a tax rate of just 3%. A public enquiry is now necessary to see how this grossly unfair deal has been allowed to stand.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is Google's largets market outside the US yet countries like France and Italy have managed to secure much larger tax deals from Google. France have secured more than £500 million and Italy £150 million-equivalent to a 15% tax rate. This deal is extremely unfair to all small businesses and other companies that are expected to pay their tax recipts in full. This deal needs to be fully and publicly investigated to see why so much money has been lost.

attributes.action: Legislation to curb newspapers from knowingly printing factual inaccuracies.
attributes.background: Given the major complaint during the EU referendum was one of factual inaccuracies there should be a way to hold newspapers to account without limiting freedom of the press. If a lie is told on the front page the apology/correction should also be on the front page thus making them more accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The press in the UK is currently beyond reproach. It can print a headline that is totally untrue and currently only be forced to print a small correction where most will not see it. 
Recognising the freedom of the press is sacrosanct we must act to ensure they are accountable in a way that does not impinge upon this. Forcing them to give equal space to which the falsehood was printed under regulation by an independent body would help deter them from knowingly printing lies for political gain.

attributes.action: Call a second EU Referendum based on independently verified Facts.
attributes.background: Based on the realization that significantly misleading and inaccurate misinformation and untruths have been officially used and admitted to influence the EU referendum. We demand the first referendum be declared void and a second and final referendum be held considering the following:-
attributes.additional_details:
•One communication be compiled and sent out to all the population containing the same agreed number of pages for each party.
•Each party be limited to three sections to complete along the lines of the following:
1. THE FACTS – These must be independently verified.
2. ASPIRATIONS 
3. A CLEAR REALISTIC PLAN OF HOW THESE ASPIRATIONS WILL BE ACHIEVED. 	
Illustrations limited to statistical and information that they contain independently verified.
We demand proven facts, not deception.

attributes.action: Ensure all future national referendums need more than 50% of electorate to pass
attributes.background: 37% of the electorate took the decision for UK to leave the EU. I believe this to be anti-democratic.
attributes.additional_details:
A minority of the electorate should not be able to take the country in a new direction. 

If an issue is so important it requires a national  referendum,  then to change the status quo it should be able to get more than 50% of the entire electorate,  regardless of turnout. If it cannot get 50% of the entire electorate it should be deemed to have failed.

attributes.action: Give weapons to Ukraine to defend herself from Russian hybrid war
attributes.background: The level of Russian aggression is rising just as our once formidable ability (back in the cold war ) to counter them seems to have vanished altogether. Instead, we have trouble simply recognizing them for what they are.
attributes.additional_details: Ukraine gave up its nuclear weapons in exchange for the grantee from the United Kingdom that they will protect the Ukrainian nation from invasion. The Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances signed in Budapest, Hungary on 5 December 1994, providing security assurances by its signatories relating to Ukraine's accession to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. The Memorandum was signed by USA and the United Kingdom..  It is time to honor the spirit of the agreement..

attributes.action: Independence referendum for N. Ireland and Scotland
attributes.background: There is a great divide between England, N. Ireland and Scotland because Scotland and N. Ireland both had majority remain but were dragged to leave the EU, we need more democracy, if they want to stay, let them, don't force them
attributes.additional_details: They all voted remain, so they should get what they want rather than being forced by another constitution that a lot of Scottish and N. Irish people want to leave. As we are the British, we pride our selves on being democratic so we must respect their decision even though we might not agree with it like when Germany, France and USA respected our decision when we voted Brexit.

attributes.action: Grant all those who have finished Secondary education the ability to vote.
attributes.background: By the end of secondary education, people have to decide where next to go in there life, whether it be further education, an apprenticeship or full time employment. At this age, people make life changing decisions about there own life. Why shouldn't they have a say in there country's life?
attributes.additional_details:
Year groups at college are split, as some people are too young to vote. Some people who are slightly too young to vote have to deal with other people's decisions until they are, in some cases, 22 years old. 
Some people can go through life with just there secondary education, and still have the ability to vote. So it cannot be argued that, in this case, with only a secondary education, teenagers do not have the mental capability to vote. 
We should allow young people to shape there future.

attributes.action: Parliament to pass a Bill affirming the UK will remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
The UK is is a Parliamentary democracy. Only Parliament has the power and the responsibility to decide this issue. Parliament is not bound by the referendum.

The majority of the UK electorate did not vote to leave.

attributes.action: We want the UK to appoint a dedicated minister for young people.
attributes.background: Young people in this country, are not being heard, and not being catered for by government. We constantly get shafted at the expense of the silver haired vote because of the perception that we aren't engaged with, or care about politics. We do care! We want somebody accountable to deal with us.
attributes.additional_details:
Ever since the 2008 recession, young people have been beaten down with a stick and told to put up.

The abolishing of EMA allowance
Trebling university fees
Taking away housing benefit for 18-21 year old's
New living wage excluding  under  25's

Are all examples of government policy designed to take away from young people in order to give to other demographics of the vote.

All in the age of low wages and astronomical rent and house prices. 
It's time we engage and let our voice be heard.

attributes.action: Stop housing associations putting registered sex offenders in their properties.
attributes.background: Recently quite a number of registered sex offenders have been allowed to reside in properties owned by a housing association. Two within yards of each other. The area the properties are in is heavily populated by children, also up the road from a school.
attributes.additional_details: One of the offenders moved a few months ago, and since reoffended and been given a custodial sentence. The other is still in residence. There was another offender who owned his property, who reoffended and has since left the area. These are the registered sex offenders we are aware of, no doubt there will be more. Our concern is allowing registered sex offenders to live in an area like this, is a recipe for disaster. We have our children to think about.

attributes.action: Make career advisers a mandatory requirement in sixth form colleges
attributes.background: Between the ages of 16 and 18 you are expected to know what you want to do with your life after your time at college, but as a hormonal confused teenager, you can easily make a detrimental decision that effects your chances of being happy with your educational and career outcome in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Many teenagers apply to university even though they have no idea what they want to study or whether they even want to go, but they still apply because their teachers and mentors expect them to. Unexplained to 16 to 18 year olds, there are many more options than university in this country and I believe that if there was a career adviser in every sixth form college to talk to students about them, they would choose their next step after higher education with a clearer goal in mind.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for legalising and decriminalising marijuana
attributes.background: Due to the current laws millions are dying and suffering when medical marijuana will help-stop this! Create jobs and and be a huge boost to the economy, health and productivity of our country it is wrong to be outlawed!

attributes.action: Child Maintenance should not be payable whilst a custody battle is ongoing
attributes.background: Where there is no evidence of domestic violence, child abduction, sexual, drug or alcohol abuse & the resident parent is withholding access from the other parent, Child Maintenance should not be awarded to the resident parent until the courts have ruled otherwise.
attributes.additional_details: Some resident parents use the child as a bargaining chip, robbing the child of a chance to know both parents. The courts can take many months to make a decision. Meanwhile, the non-resident parent pays thousands of pounds to perpetuate the injustice of not seeing the child. Where there is no evidence of abuse or evidence to support risk of abduction, the non-resident parent should not be paying thousands while not allowed contact with the child.

attributes.action: Make consumer debt statute barred after 4 not 6 years.
attributes.background: Currently, creditors can sue for repayment of debts for up to 6 yrs after default or payment. The Courts are overwhelmed. In 2014, there were 1.5 million claims issued and 410,000 judgments with 54 weeks from claim to hearing. By reducing the statute bar to 4 years, this would reduce the claims.
attributes.additional_details: Of £470 bn of consumer debt, £50 billion is now owned by debt purchase companies, who buy bank and credit card balances for 2-10% of their value and then use the Courts to get 100% repayment, making super profits in the process. One company owns £17bn of consumer debt and reported a profit of £196 million last year.By reducing the statute bar to four years, the number of claims would be reduced, the Courts could cope better, and original lenders would be OK. Consumers would be the winners

attributes.action: Restore Northumberland to its pre-1974 borders.
attributes.background: Newcastle and North Tyneside used to belong to the historic county of Northumberland. the Local Government Act 1972 created the existence of the Metropolitan county of Tyne & Wear. Tyne and Wear County Council was abolished in 1986, and so its districts are now unitary authorities (self governed).
attributes.additional_details: the county of Tyne and Wear has virtually no relevance. Therefore, the districts of Newcastle and North Tyneside could be absorbed back into the borders of Northumberland and still keep their unitary authority status. The historical importance of Northumberland is extremely important to the people of Newcastle and North Tyneside. it is time to restore Northumbrian identity.

attributes.action: Give a vote in the EU referendum to EU citizens who have been in UK for 10 years
attributes.background: EU citizens who have children born in the UK and are effectively permanently resident have a stake in this country's future.  Some are married to British citizens and have been for decades.
attributes.additional_details: My wife is French and has lived in and paid taxes in the UK for 50 years but not allowed a vote.  My MP said she should have become British.

attributes.action: Charge individuals / corporations with Treason for evading / avoiding Tax.
attributes.background: It should be an act of Treason to the British State / Crown to knowingly avoid / evade paying dues to this country by collaborating with another country to hide monies owed.
attributes.additional_details: The Treason Act 1348 defines 'Aiding the enemy' as Treason. To collude with a foreign bank / country to avoid / evade Tax due should be considered an intention to 'aid the enemy'.

attributes.action: Mandatory 'call-in' of Planning Applications on 10 signatures of Parish electors
attributes.background: Now County Hall staff decide 90% of Planning Applications despite opposition of local residents, parish councils and county councillors. There is no democratic control. PAs should be decided by the Planning Committee (comprised of elected councillors) at the request of 10 parish residents.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Applications affect all our lives and vast sums of money are involved. 90% of all applications are decided by unelected council employees with no control by parish councils or elected members. This is plainly wrong and undemocratic. It also leads to allegations or suspicions of underhand influence by those seeking planning permission.  When a Parish Council wants to co-opt a new member, upon the request of 10 members there must be an election; hence the number 10 in this petition.

attributes.action: Stop NHS England offering PET/CT services to private companies such as Alliance
attributes.background:
NHS England is reprocuring PET/CT services, and has invited bids from healthcare providers, including private providers such as Alliance healthcare to submit bids.

If a private company wins the contract to provide this service, they will do so by offering them at a reduced price & take the profit
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thestrategicprojectsteam.co.uk/increasing-patient-access-to-vital-diagnostic-tests/

http://www.theguardian.com/healthcare-network/2015/aug/04/how-to-sell-off-the-nhs-in-nine-easy-steps

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/nhs-sell-out-tories-sign-largest-5323402

http://www.alliancemedical.co.uk/what-we-do/patient-services/national-petct-contract

attributes.action: Re-Nationalise Rail Infrastructure.
attributes.background: Our National Rail infrastructure not run as a service since it was privatised, it is run as a business, and as a result passengers are forced to endure price increase after price increase and worsening services.
attributes.additional_details:
After speaking to Staff and fellow commuters, the following differences are apparent due to being run as a business and are unacceptable.

Outside of timetabled services, commuters are no longer a priority over freight.

When service is disrupted, trains are cancelled rather than run late as it saves the company money, but at the expense of running trains for the commuters.

Priority is given to sections of infrastructure where there are competing franchises or services.

attributes.action: Introduce gender neutral toilets in all public places
attributes.background: The transgender and non-binary community is one that is becoming increasingly more prevalent in the UK as citizens become more socially aware, but there is a significant lack of facilities available for them to use in public which can cause discomfort and dysphoria for certain individuals.

attributes.action: Change the legislation, so that Non Binary people are recognised under the law
attributes.background: Currently, the only genders recognised under the law are 'Male' and 'Female'. This makes people who do not identify as either gender uncomfortable and is discrimative. Please change this legislation.
attributes.additional_details: It has emerged, in the recent report, allowing Transgender people to change their gender, on their passport, without a medical certificate. This is a big step, but there's much further to go. The 'X' box gender should be allowed, and therefore this legislation should be changed, recognising all gender identities, be that to one, all or no genders. Everyone is valid and deserves to be represented.

attributes.action: figures/statistics quoted in political campaigns should be official&independent
attributes.background:
Regardless of ones politics, bogus financial/figures and claims are put forward.

To restore faith in politics and so people can make an informed decision, all facts/statistics should be from a central source, who verify statistics for use.

Deviation from this should be made an offence.

attributes.action: Make History a mandatory Core subject which can't be dropped
attributes.background: History is a subject which has enormous value. It teaches us the successes and errors which have happened in the past so we can learn from. At this current point in time children are not appreciating what their ancestors did for them and how Society has been shaped by historical actions.

attributes.action: Give teachers correct training on peer exclusion
attributes.background: Kids are social creatures, and they need to be in relationships to feel right. Isolating involves cutting someone off from essential relationships. Some kids are pushed into a social ‘no man's land’ by the exclusionary efforts of their peers.
attributes.additional_details: This isolation is itself a problem, as its victims can easily become disconnected. Most of us can identify with the hurt, anger, pain, and bewilderment that anyone might feel in a situation (of social exclusion).Imagine the impact, then, on a child whose whole universe revolves around acceptance, friendships, and the need for support from peers. It is devastating.This is an invisible form of bully and hard to prove but has a massive impact on children of all ages, teacher need to know the signs!

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: Single-use plastic bottles are not designed to be re-used. Thus, many people buy and later throw these bottles away. These bottles, like much litter, ends up on streets and is blown by the wind, into rivers, polluting them.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic harms the environment and our health. Animals often die from being suffocated and poisoned by it. Some marine organisms, like fish, can be eaten by humans, spreading the plastic further into the food chain.

Banning these bottles leaves people with suitable alternatives. Re-usable plastic bottles are not the most eco-friendly alternative, but is still a better option as they can be re-used several times. Metal bottles can be used as they are made to last for a much longer time.

attributes.action: The UK Government should impose sanctions on Countries that operate 'Tax Havens'
attributes.background:
Tax avoidance through use of 'Tax Havens' is a huge issue, costing our country Billions of pounds. 

The excuse we hear for it is that a lot of it 'complies with the rules' or isn't illegal, because other countries have different laws or practices.

We should take action to encourage they change
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals and companies avoid tax (while we're paying it) by using tax havens, they say until the countries that provide those havens stop, we can't stop it. 

Then put sanctions on those countries! 

The money they help hide takes the care away from our people who need it, stops the potholes being filled in AND means we all pay more tax. If we can put sanctions on countries for hurting their population and enemies, then we can do do for countries allowing practices that hurt Britons.

attributes.action: Get rid of the extra 3 per cent stamp duty bill
attributes.background: From April 1 2016, anyone purchasing an additional property will have to pay an extra 3 per cent stamp duty.  The changes apply to companies and individuals no matter how many properties you are purchasing.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone owning a second property that isn't their main residence and buying another, or replacing the one they don't live in, is likely to get caught up in the changes. So even if you are applying for a joint mortgage to enable someone to get on the property ladder as a first time buyer you have to pay the stamp duty making it impossible for first time buyers.

attributes.action: Debate smoking inside shared buildings and flats. Unavoidable passive smoking.
attributes.background: Neighbours smoking inside shared buildings/ flats is a real issue of  health and quality of life for many families and children. As more flats are built in the UK's towns/ cities it is now more relevant for discussion. Current position is rights of the smoker favoured of a majority of those effected
attributes.additional_details:
Relying on the implementation of a lease alteration for smoking is not practical. It is expensive, complicated and involves all parties being willing to adopt.

The health effects of passive smoking are well documented as are the damage it has on young children.

Home insurance premiums may be proportionately higher as a smoker lives in the building. Heating bills may be higher as those affected open windows to combat the smoke.

Many of the UK's homes are old and cannot be made 'air tight'.

attributes.action: Strip the regulatory bodies of their charitable status
attributes.background: Health care professionals allied to medicine in the National Health Service are regulated by their regulatory bodies to protect the public. Many are charities. Being charities they have deprived the taxman of money. They can bring about poverty as they do not allocate their charitable funds equally.
attributes.additional_details:
They don't allocate funds equally.

If you are subject to proceedings the prosecution has a a huge untapped fund which is not available to the defendant. Their defence bodies defend may not defend you so you may have to fund this yourself. You may struggle to get work until the conclusion, guilty or not. If found guilty you can't get work in anything compounding poverty. At the appeal they have that unlimited pool the defendant does not and then may have costs awarded compounding poverty.

attributes.action: All busses to give change by law.
attributes.background:
This is exactly as it sounds.

I want it to be made law that all busses have to give you chance when paying for your ticket.

Currently some buses do and some do not but the large majority of buses on their timetable says "no change given"
attributes.additional_details: Obviously this would be "within reason" for example I wouldn't want them having to issue change for a £50 note as this would be unreasonable but I would expect change given for up to a £10 note as this is the lowest you can get from an ATM.

attributes.action: Stop moving the retirement age. If aged 50 plus you can't adapt your finances.
attributes.background: The government should only change the retirement age for those entering the system. People need to know their retirement date will not change for their working life. It is very difficult to plan for retirement when the date constantly increases. Those aged 50 are particularly disadvantaged.
attributes.additional_details: During my working life my retirement age has already increaed  at least twice. Other workers in a similar difficult position are finding it so hard to plan for their retirement when the date keeps moving. Those aged 50 plus are especially hard hit by these changes both emotionally and financially. A person needs to know for certain their retirement age from the day they reach 18 and that date should not be altered, especially not by five or ten years.

attributes.action: Allow HM forces and government employees overseas to access British TV online
attributes.background:
Currently HM Forces Troops and government personnel based overseas are unable to access UK television online due to location restrictions.  

It is proposed that eligible personnel be allowed to purchase a UK TV licence which would give them access privileges to online services.

attributes.action: The British government should refer to Israel as “Apartheid Israel”
attributes.background: The UK government should use as frequently as possible the terminology “Apartheid Israel” rather than just Israel because South African anti-Apartheid icons like Desmond Tutu have confirmed that Israel's system of brutal ethnic separation and occupation is far worse than South African Apartheid
attributes.additional_details: South African John Dugard, the former U.N. Special Rapporteur on Human Rights said: "I’m a South African who lived through Apartheid. I've no hesitation in saying that Israel’s crimes are infinitely worse than those committed by the Apartheid regime of South Africa."  Veteran Jewish anti-Apartheid activist Denis Goldberg, who was sentenced with Nelson Mandela to life in prison in the 1964 Rivonia treason trial said: "There is no doubt in my mind that Israel is an Apartheid state".

attributes.action: Any consideration-wholly or partially-of NHS Professionals must be debated fully
attributes.background: NHS professionals is publicly owned and is said to be running at a profit of 8 million pounds.  Our hospitals rely heavily upon this agency to safely staff our hospitals with key medical staff such as nurses and doctors.  This is yet another branch of our NHS currently being reported as under threat
attributes.additional_details: This report was shared today https://www.rt.com/uk/333270-nhs-professionals-privatized-deloitte/#.VstIPcCmq_k.facebook which is worrying news that NHS professionals may be sold off.  If this organisation is running at a profit of 8 million pounds per year what justification can there be for this?  Surely in the longer term this will cost our NHS more money for the same or similar service and it is an organisation which is crucial to the safe staffing of our hospitals.  Our NHS is important to us

attributes.action: Stop the forced removal of Kaveh Ghandizadeh Dezfuli by the Home Office.
attributes.background: Kaveh Ghandizadeh Dezfuli, an Iranian musician, has been living in the UK since 2010. He has fully assimilated and integrated into British society. Since living in London, Mr Dezfuli has performed with prominent Iranian dissident musicians.
attributes.additional_details: These performances have been broadcast on Manoto TV & BBC Persia which has led to him being in danger of persecution should he return to Iran. Mr Dezfuli presented this evidence at the Home Office's Capital Building in Liverpool on the 15th December 2015. The evidence was NOT read, but rather, he was detained in a detention centre in Manchester that night. He is currently in Morton Hall Detention Centre in Lincolnshire. He has now been informed that he will be removed by the 20th January 2016.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a persons next of kin to overrule a donor card.
attributes.background: At the moment a persons next of kin can refuse to donate your organs even if you have registered yourself as an organ donor. This is unfair, the whole point of registering yourself means you wish to donate and next of kin should not be able to go against this.

attributes.action: Stop the HMRC phone number being a premium rate and make it free.
attributes.background:
This number is mainly used by people on a low income, elderly people on pensions and those that are registered disabled.
It's charging the people that are less fortunate and really can't afford it.
And average call to the tax office I have found has been 30minutes minimum

attributes.action: Introduce a radical overhaul of British football’s development of youth talent.
attributes.background: We call on Tracey Crouch MP (minister of Sport) and the government, to implement a German-style ‘Extended Talent Promotion Programme’ within British football. We need a similar radical overhaul of how we coach youth football, how we structure our youth development, and how we nurture young talent.

attributes.action: Any new Prime Minister must have the confidence of the people and Parliament
attributes.background: We call for the Fixed-term Parliaments Act to be amended such that any new Prime Minister’s government must face an explicit vote of confidence in the Commons. If no government can win such a vote, a general election must be held.
attributes.additional_details:
After the EU Referendum result and the Prime Minister’s resignation, Parliament must show confidence in the Government or call a general election.

 The Government and any new Prime Minister have no mandate for post-referendum negotiations. The exceptional circumstances and political division require a new mandate.

 Petitions cannot call for a vote of No Confidence, nor for the dissolution of Parliament, but they can ask for an amendment to legislation such as the Fixed-term Parliaments Act.

attributes.action: Make the National Insurance Number required to sign a Parliament Petition.
attributes.background:
In the highlight of the recent EU Referendum there is/was a Petition calling for a 2nd Referendum that received millions of signatures which received a lot of scrutiny.

This is because it is all too easy to sign a petition, there is no way to confirm that the person signing is a British Citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
So my proposal is to make the National Insurance Number a required piece of information to sign a petition.

This way ONLY British Citizens over the age of 16 years of age can sign a Petition and they can only sign it once, as opposed to the current format in which a person only requires a different email to sign the same petition again.

attributes.action: Give the right to vote to EU citizens having lived in the UK for 5 years or more
attributes.background: EU residents, who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more, have the right to get UK citizenship. However many people do not exercise this option for various reasons and, consequently, they do not have the right to vote. Brexit referendum has shown risks deriving from the lack of this voting right
attributes.additional_details: EU residents are net contributors to the UK economy and represent a crucial asset for the sustainable development of this country. Giving voting rights to EU residents who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more would mean the recognition of a fair right and would allow EU residents to have their say on topics that have a direct impact on their lives (such as the recent EU referendum)

attributes.action: Hold a General Election by May 2017 to ensure UK not governed by unelected PM
attributes.background: During the referendum the Leave campaign continually stressed that a key issue was not wanting to be governed by unelected representatives (even though EU has elected MEPs). Therefore, now there is such key work to be done, we must have a nationally elected Prime Minister, not a nominated one.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament needs to act to call a General Election before May 2017 to ensure that key decisions are taken with a true mandate. As part of this, no action should be taken by any interim prime minister to activate Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

attributes.action: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate students' mobile phones
attributes.background: Phones should not be confiscated because it is the students personal property. Schools have no technical right to be able to take their phones as they have no possession over the property.

attributes.action: Regulate wasteful, non-essential overnight lighting of non-residential buildings
attributes.background: Seeking to improve & regulate employer's environmental policies requiring shops, offices and public sector buildings to turn off all unnecessary lighting overnight, allowing local councils to make exceptions for Christmas and other special occasions, and in certain tourist or cultural areas, only.
attributes.additional_details:
Follow the example of France, which introduced in 2013 the new law seeking to significantly reduce light pollution and carbon emissions by allowing local authorities to enforce fines on businesses breaking the rules, while cutting off power to repeat offenders. 

The rules should seek to target non-essential overnight lighting of shop windows and the fronts of buildings, making businesses greener & aware of their social responsibility, while significantly cutting carbon emissions per annum.

attributes.action:
Make it illegal for UK private nurseries to charge parents for 
Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Private nurseries in the UK charge parents for every Bank Holiday in the UK (8 in total) but the nursery remains closed. This can cost parents in excess over £1,000 PER CHILD before a child turns school age. Parents are paying for a service that is not provided and does not exist.

attributes.action: Restore Capital punishment for terrorists & killers of our police & Armed Forces
attributes.background:
Capital Punishment was abolished in 1969.
and for treason was abolished in 1998
With the ever increasing global threat from terrorism, now is the time to restore Capital punishment
Those who seek to murder by terrorism or kill our armed forces and police should pay the ultimate price
attributes.additional_details:
With the heinous murder of Lee Rigby by terrorists, it showed how great the threat to our country really was.
Those who would seek to murder our citizens, Armed Forces and police should face the ultimate sanction.
Furthermore, there is now a fresh threat to our shores from Irish terrorists.
It is time that Capital punishment for the offences of terrorism, murder of Armed Forces and police was brought back on to the statute books.
The evil cowards who cause death and destruction deserve no less

attributes.action: Require NHS Trusts to publish amounts paid for early severance etc.
attributes.background: At a time when it is so important that expenditure in the NHS is not only well controlled and appropriately targeted, NHS Trusts should be required to publicly account for such payments.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence recently published by the Eastern Daily Press shows that £6m  was spent in two years by East of England Ambulance Service.  Another Ambulance Service appears to have expended significant amounts but does not quantify that and other NHS trusts have failed to reveal this information.  At a time when it is so important that expenditure in the NHS is not only well controlled and appropriately targeted, NHS Trusts should be required to publicly account for such payments.

attributes.action: Make voting a legal requirement
attributes.background: In Australia most noteablly, but in other countries to, voting in all official elections (local and general elections) is a legal requirement. Punishable under court of law, usually with a hefty fine.
attributes.additional_details: With many local councils registered a 35% or lower turn out rate, democracy is all but dead in this country (cited by BBC) I want to ensure that we get large turnouts for general elections, local elections and national referendums (eg EU). This will have the knock on effect of bring the power back to the public of the UK and reinstating a true reflection of what the nation wants as its governments
